name: Sweet and Cozy!
Modern Downtown APT Next To Boston Common
host_about:
Hi there!
Thanks for looking into my profile . My name is Hasan. I work for a financial technology firm as a head of business development. As a side gig, I have been an airbnb host for 3 years managing 8 units in Boston and Cambridge. 

As you may have already seen, hotel prices are insanely expensive in Boston.  Thankfully, we are still able to offer affordable stays for those who are on a tight budget for their travel despite the fact that the city and hotel lobbies are cracking down on airbnb.

Why Do I host?
 I love the fact that people can still find affordable stays through Airbnb. When a family of 4 visits their daughter in May for graduation, they can book a place for $250/night instead of paying over $1000/night for a hotel stay. It means a lot to me! ( there was a time my parents could not come from overseas to visit me just because we could not afford their stay! ) 

My priority is to provide well located affordable stays to families and business travelers. I guarantee you that you will find a clean, well designed and conveniently located units with 24/7 assistance . 

However, if you have high standards, luxury buildings or jacuzzi tubs in the unit, my apartments may not be best option for you: Considering over $4000/month rents for a rundown building in Boston, I am not able to afford high end buildings to host guests on airbnb. You shall look for different options for your satisfactions. 

For others, I am more than happy to host you! Let's keep this community happy

Regards,
Hasan

name: Spacious and Quiet Apartment in Roslindale
★ Spacious & Modern | Close to Subway + Downtown ★
host_about:
Hi there!

We are Boris and Susan - a young, professional couple living in Boston. 

I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

host_about: Stacy and I love to travel! Some of our favorite destinations are Croatia, Bosnia, Egypt, Italy, Cape Verde and Greece. Traveling comes from our love of culture and history. We both have hospitality industry experience and keeping our guests happy and providing them with all of the information they need to enjoy their stay is one of the best parts of hosting. name: Lux 2 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WiFi
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Private bed and bath in sunny, modern home
host_about:
Jen and Brandon live in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston with our sweet Carolina dog, Addy. Jen is the director of research and opportunities at an industrial design firm, and she spends her spare time drawing cartoons and baking pastries. Brandon is the founder and principal consultant of Particle LLC - branding and digital strategy for mission-driven organizations. In his spare time he plays guitar in an indie pop/rock/Americana band and manages a local record label. Together, we love to travel, hike, bike, cook, stroll around Boston, and go out to eat in our awesome neighborhood.

We love using Airbnb to both find interesting and affordable accommodations when we travel, and share our home with guests from out of town.

name: Entire home- great location at a special price!
host_about:
Hi Fellow Travelers!
 
I am Joanna, a current candidate in a Master’s program in Sustainable International Development at Brandeis! As a student in an international program, I truly value traveling in addition to music and other hobbies involving exploring the world. I believe Airbnb is a great platform for anyone who wants to travel and enjoys visiting different places and cultures! 
 
I've lived in Spain, grew up in North Carolina, and now consider myself a Bostonian. My home in South Boston is very comfortable and right next the beach where I enjoy jogging in the mornings! I would like to share my place while I'm Airbnbing since I believe my home will bring happiness and a true Boston experience :) 
 
When I'm not traveling or studying, I enjoy nonfiction books such as "A New Earth Awakening" By Eckhart Tolle or simply relaxing at the beach near Castle Island. 
 
As a host, I will do my best to provide you with a very comfortable stay in my home and provide with the very best tips for visiting Boston. As a guest, I will respect your home and truly appreciate the space given to me.

name: Walk to the Beach or City room 6
host_about: Stacy and I love to travel! Some of our favorite destinations are Croatia, Bosnia, Egypt, Italy, Cape Verde and Greece. Traveling comes from our love of culture and history. We love to participate in local adventures, attend events happening wherever we are, but most importantly, meet new people and try new cuisines!  Music is a huge part of our lives, all genres, and if we have down time, we kick up our feet and watch a movie! We can tell you where to go for the best restaurants and events happening around the city.  Keeping up to date with new dining and entertainment venues is something we really enjoy. We work a ton and don't get away as much as we like lately, so we love to entertain and are also Airbnb hosts.  We both have hospitality industry experience and keeping our guests happy and providing them with all of the information they need to enjoy their stay is one of the best parts of hosting. We look forward to meeting you during our travels or in the company of our home! Come stay with us and experience Boston like a local!

*****

We speak English, Spanish and Portuguese.
  *******

Stefano and Silvia (must love cats, thank you :))
host_about: Hi there, thanks for looking up my listing, I hope you like what you see. I have a beautiful inviting apartment around the corner from the red line in Boston and would love to welcome you during your holiday, relocation or visit. I also have a new home in Providence I am constantly updating. When not in Boston or Providence, I can be found on photo assignments all around New England. When not on assignments, decorating or hosting, I may be found roaming the four corners of the world. My favorite part of the world is South East Asia (I've spent multiple Winters in Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia, Japan, China, Myanmar, India, The Philippines and Indonesia to name a few ;)) and more recent trips have taken me to Guadeloupe, Panama, Colombia and various other Central and South American countries. I speak French, Spanish and English mostly and understand a few other languages; I love roaming the world, discovering new cultures and meeting new people. I started hosting on Airbnb in April 2016 and I am loving it and loving the privilege of hosting people from around the world! I can assure you that I will do my best to make sure your trip is as wonderful as it should be. I look forward to hearing from you and hopefully hosting you soon; don't hesitate to reach out or ask me anything. :)

name: Freedom Trail Condo
Renovated modern 1 bed beside State House
host_about: I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband, sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts, is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding, jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making, live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups, birthday parties, bachelorette parties, make your own wedding bands, create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

name: Lux 1 Bedroom Apt Near Waterfront w/wifi
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

I had amazing airbnb experiences throughout and am looking forward to welcoming others to my home now as a host! Outside of traveling and medicine, I also enjoy photography, biking, finding new hobbies (currently trying to tackle the unicycle-- tips appreciated), and just general romping around town. I look forward to meeting you, and please don't hesitate to let me know if there are any ways I can help you with planning your trip!

name: Sunny Private Room in Beautiful Chestnut hill
host_about:
My name is ChiChi. Welcome to Boston, home my sweet home! 

I have a passion for travel and all types of outdoor activities. I love meeting new people from different cultural backgrounds, which offers me the chance to interact with some amazing minds/ideas and also makes me a positive, interesting, and thoughtful person. And I have been enjoying hosting guests from all over the world and help to make their stay in Boston memorable.

I am a working professional in my early 30th with a full-time job in a well-known bank in downtown Boston. In my spare time, I travel, yoga, dance, hike, read, blog, movie, and spend quality time with my friends. I am a good cook, infusing my recipes with inspirations from world traveling. 

I can speak English, Chinese, Korean and Spanish, and I am learning French!

name: Southie Townhome with Private Room/Bath/Entrance!
host_about: We are a small family who have been in Boston for 5 years!

name: Eagle Street Condo
host_about: I'm a fun, outgoing 30 year old living in Boston. Love to travel, now with my dog, Grace, and whomever else wants to join my adventures. I'm a working professional in outside sales for a top human capital management company. I also enjoy outdoor activities such as camping, hiking, running, golfing and skiing; as well as going out to dinner and trying new restaurants.

name: H2, 2 min walk to T/Metro, 17 min to Downtown
host_about:
Just like many of you, I have a wanderlust. I always love the adventure of travel – the unknown, something different, something new.  I have been extremely lucky to continuously feed my passion for travel. 

I love the excitement of it all–feeling like an explorer–discovering a new land, a new language, new money and all the little challenges that go along with it. When I travel, I am more spontaneous and don't live for the future or the past… just in the moment. 

I love the rush. Habitual runners get off on the kick-in of endorphins that give them that extra boost they need to keep going. I get the same jolt from a day of travel or an unexpected side trip to a new and undiscovered land that I hadn't planned to visit.  Traveling seems to give me a near constant adrenaline rush.  After a few years of uninterrupted travel, I became quite addicted to this feeling. 

I love the logistics. I like landing in a new place and trying to figure it all out myself. Where to get money. How to speak the language. How to go from point A to point B. How to pack my bag right so I don't go insane after packing it for the 135th time. 

I love meeting new people all the time. In no other time in my life have I met so many people and made so many new friends in such a short time.  The world is full of friendly, generous people. 

I love the freedom. I experience a great feeling of independence from traveling. I can go wherever I want, whenever I want. I can sleep in. I can stay out late. It's all up to me.

host_about:
Justin and I met in DC and just got married and bought our house in JP.  We love the neighborhood--it's quiet and green but a short bus or t-ride downtown.  We have a huge guest room that we like to fill with friends when we can, but we thought it would be fun to host others when it's free.  

Lawyers by day, in our free time, we like to spend a lot of time outside--hiking, rock climbing, backpacking, and learning to garden.  And we're planning some crafty indoor projects for winter, like refinishing furniture.

We hope you'll enjoy staying with us.  JP has great restaurants, an easy commute downtown and some great green spaces to explore.

name: Sonder | Seaport District | Dashing 2BR + Laundry
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. host_about: Ann: Quilt artist, cyclist, beach and desert lover, school librarian, off-the-beaten track traveler... I'm also very fond of good beer and good ice cream. Esther: Woodworker and fabric crafter, intrepid nature photographer, excited to welcome people into our new space.

name: H5, 2 min walk to T/Subway, 17 min to Downtown
host_about:
Just like many of you, I have a wanderlust. I always love the adventure of travel – the unknown, something different, something new.  I have been extremely lucky to continuously feed my passion for travel. 

I love the excitement of it all–feeling like an explorer–discovering a new land, a new language, new money and all the little challenges that go along with it. When I travel, I am more spontaneous and don't live for the future or the past… just in the moment. 

I love the rush. Habitual runners get off on the kick-in of endorphins that give them that extra boost they need to keep going. I get the same jolt from a day of travel or an unexpected side trip to a new and undiscovered land that I hadn't planned to visit.  Traveling seems to give me a near constant adrenaline rush.  After a few years of uninterrupted travel, I became quite addicted to this feeling. 

I love the logistics. I like landing in a new place and trying to figure it all out myself. Where to get money. How to speak the language. How to go from point A to point B. How to pack my bag right so I don't go insane after packing it for the 135th time. 

I love meeting new people all the time. In no other time in my life have I met so many people and made so many new friends in such a short time.  The world is full of friendly, generous people. 

I love the freedom. I experience a great feeling of independence from traveling. I can go wherever I want, whenever I want. I can sleep in. I can stay out late. It's all up to me.

name: Becon Hill/MGH
Lux 1BR Apt in Bulfinch Triangle w/gym & WiFi
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

host_about:
I've had the pleasure of hosting hundreds of guests at my Airbnb listings, and have been a guest myself at a number of Airbnb properties around the world. I'm very familiar with the properties I've listed, so no question will go unanswered. As a guest, I have stayed in bargain Airbnbs with the absolute bare minimum of furnishings. They feel like understocked prisons! I've tried really hard to do the opposite with my properties, thinking ahead about guest needs and including little touches of home where I can. From vegetable peelers and wine openers, to rugs, art, and outdoor seating, I want you to enjoy a luxurious experience.

I'm a traveler at heart (50+ countries and counting!), and I love being able to share a unique travel experience with guests, so don't hesitate if you have a question. My interests include: travel, rock climbing, snowboarding, cycling, soccer, photography, art, and writing.

name: Astonishing 1 Bed South End Boston's Best Location
host_about:
I am an Artist who has lived in Boston all my life. I love living in the city, but also enjoy getting away for work or visiting my husband’s relatives in Greece.

I have been renting my apartments for decades, although furnished now, I know how important it is to make your stay easy and comfortable. Your accommodations are exactly as advertised. The amenities are as luxurious as our former wonderful guests specify. The apartment is short term rental specifically designed for your total comfort. As our guests mentioned "The pictures don’t do it any justice."

My husband Alex and I take the feedback we have gotten from our initial guests very seriously, and have implemented all suggestions to improve the apartment and the experience…. Even though all of our reviews are very positive, we strive to always improve ourselves and our apartments.

As a host, we will be as involved with your trip as much as you want. If you would like to get recommendations as to where to go, what to do, and places to eat we will most certainly help you with that, but if you rather be left alone, we will let you enjoy your privacy of your own apartment while visiting Boston.

Enjoy your visit to Boston and when you are finished with your day of tourism or work, you can return to your rental home. REST and RELAX in a clean and well-appointed apartment. The goal is that you have a worry free and comfortable stay. 

Welcome to Boston and its historic South End!

Sincerely,
Stephanie & Alex

name: H8, 2 min walk to T/Subway, 17 min to Downtown
host_about:
Just like many of you, I have a wanderlust. I always love the adventure of travel – the unknown, something different, something new.  I have been extremely lucky to continuously feed my passion for travel. 

I love the excitement of it all–feeling like an explorer–discovering a new land, a new language, new money and all the little challenges that go along with it. When I travel, I am more spontaneous and don't live for the future or the past… just in the moment. 

I love the rush. Habitual runners get off on the kick-in of endorphins that give them that extra boost they need to keep going. I get the same jolt from a day of travel or an unexpected side trip to a new and undiscovered land that I hadn't planned to visit.  Traveling seems to give me a near constant adrenaline rush.  After a few years of uninterrupted travel, I became quite addicted to this feeling. 

I love the logistics. I like landing in a new place and trying to figure it all out myself. Where to get money. How to speak the language. How to go from point A to point B. How to pack my bag right so I don't go insane after packing it for the 135th time. 

I love meeting new people all the time. In no other time in my life have I met so many people and made so many new friends in such a short time.  The world is full of friendly, generous people. 

I love the freedom. I experience a great feeling of independence from traveling. I can go wherever I want, whenever I want. I can sleep in. I can stay out late. It's all up to me.

name: (R12) Simple Studio in Beacon Hill
host_about: Ambitious and full of life! My team,  Samara, Gio, Allen , Theresa and I are here to make your Boston stay, the best stay possible! We are always available to give great travel advice, restaurant & night life suggestions,  and professional Real Estate guidance!   On the Airbnb Messenger, you'll be speaking with myself or one of my teammates! Maintenance & repairs are with Gio or one of our subs! Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed!

name: Old school place in Boston's Little Italy
host_about: I was born and raised in Boston's historical North End aka Little Italy.. I love the idea of letting guest  expierence the history and culture of the North End through the eyes of a Italian not some transplant who moved here.I live in a different unit in the same complex.I run a tour company during the summer months so I can be a bundle of information for you. My tour company is Politically  incorrect North End tours ((website hidden)) but that's a story for another time but you can see where that name came from when I called a non original  North Ender some transplant.

name: Bedroom in Luxe apt with stellar views & balcony!
host_about: I'm a media/marketing/communications professional who worked in the television news industry for nearly 20 years.  I love my work, but my passion is travel!  I've been to at least 22 countries (I've lost count!) and am always ready for more!  I've used Airbnb many times since joining and I love it!!  It's the coolest thing ever!  I live in Boston and ride a scooter and love animals... mine and yours!  And the best part is the connections I make with the hosts and guests.  It's always nice to meet new people and learn about their lives and culture by staying in their homes or having them in mine.

name: Boston Elegance with free parking
host_about: My name is Sarah, I'm a single mother and originally from Africa. I have lived in the US for 19+ years. I am an exceptionally kind, caring and considerate person with a big heart. I love meeting people and relating very well with them even at first sight. I am a professional in the Health care delivery, and work flexible hours. I love to watch TV and multicultural films with my family at my leisure time. Travelling to see the world is something I desire to do when the time comes, right now I enjoy the pleasure of the world coming to me via Airbnb. It is a great honor to be your host!

name: Quiet cozy 2 BR w/parking - monthly thru March
host_about: With the exception of 5 years in NYC, I’m a lifelong Bostonian with a serious case of wander lust. I have travelled extensively across 4 continents and dream of getting to get to the other three. I have a wonderful husband and two young boys (ages 5 and 7) who make travel even more fun and rewarding. As much as I love to travel, I also love the New England coast, especially Maine where my husband and I recently purchased a beautiful new beach home. We’ve been renting this home on Airbnb and have loved sharing it with people from all over the world.

name: Great Location,Near T, Zip Car Pickup & Blue Hills
host_about:
I enjoy the city life as well as nature.  I have the best of both worlds here...the Neponset River Greenway Trail is behind the house and the Blue Hills Reservation is 10 minutes away.  I can go for a walk, hike, ride horses, visit Houghton's Pond, ride bikes, have a game of tennis or basketball, roller blade and ski in the winter!  I am also 2 minutes away from the nearest bus stop so it's easy enough to take a bus over to the Red Line train to grab a bite and shop in Downtown Boston!  Some of my favorite pastimes! 
A motto that I like to live by is: Live, Love, Laugh!!

name: SPACIOUS for Friendly Roommates, w/ All utilities
Stylish Studio in the Back Bay, on Newbury St, .#9
host_about:
Welcome to our profile, and allow us to introduce ourselves! For over twenty years, Maverick Suites has been providing boutique furnished apartments amongst brownstones all over Boston! We know the magic of this city, and love being a short-term stay for travelers from all across the globe. For the past three years, we have offered 80 of our units to Airbnb adventurers, and have had well-over thousands of stays! With studios across the city, stay on Newbury Street, the South End, Beacon Hill or Coolidge Corner depending on your travel plans.

Fueled by native, passionate team members, our team is here to provide an affordable and accommodating stay every time. Abbi, Mohammed, and Andrea are here to help answer any question or concern within minutes! Sometimes, you just can't get the AC to turn on. We get it. Every issue, every question, every restaurant recommendation (we have plenty), we want to assist you!

Sincerely,
The Cool Neighbors (Maverick Suites)

name: QUIET SUNNY 1BR LOCATION, CHARM and CONVENIENCE
host_about:
I am a Bostonian, first generation Irish. I love to travel and meet people from different cultures. 
I raised my daughters in the SE, 2 blocks from the Airbnb, and have delighted equally what has remained the same and what has changed in my neighborhood. 
I am a mother, a grandmother, a RE broker with Gibson Sotheby’s International Realty and a yoga teacher.  I am very involved in numerous charities and non profits that work with homeless folk, veterans, and the recovery community. 
In the 70’s I ran a restaurant in the White Mountains where I quickly learned every aspect of the business and developed a passion for hospitality. 
Earlier this year, after a tenant moved out, I did some renovations. I joined Airbnb on Halloween 2017. It’s been all treats so far! I am grateful to my fantastic guests and look forward to hosting you soon! Safe travels! Mary, Erica and Tessie

name: Large studio space, private entrance and walk to T

We both love to travel and meet new people. We also like exploring new restaurants and shops while trying to maintaining an active and healthy lifestyle.

We love to travel, spend time with family and find great restaurants. Valerie is from Ireland and Michael is Boston born and raised. We have four beautiful boys. 
As an airbnb guest, very clean and comfortable is the hope. I don't need anything super fancy, just a good overall experience, a few restaurant recommendations and a responsive host. As a host, I would strive to provide the same, if not more, and make it so that you couldn't wait to return! :)

name: Historical Charming Private Newbury St Brownstone
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! I love the movie The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles and The Animals. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 29 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your Boston stay, the best stay possible! Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and night life suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

name: North End hideout with a view!
Back Bay/South End
Richmond's Cozy Colonial near Lower Mills
host_about:
I am a father of two young boys (ages 10 and 6yrs), and I work in the holistic health field as a practitioner and educator. I travel frequently with my boys and, sometimes, I travel solo when continuing my studies with my teachers and mentors. It is in these cases that Airbnb particularly serves my interests. I like sports of all kinds, any music with a soul, and locally produced food, art, and products of all kinds.
The thing I most can't live without is hot water with lemon in the morning. Other than that, I might go so far as to say that I NEED fresh eggs, chips & salsa,  a craft beer or two, and a pillow under my head and another on my chest. As a guest, I like to think I'm fairly low maintenance and try to offer more to my hosts than what I require of them. Either way, I am happy to be a joiner or lock myself away in isolation.

name: Location! Beautiful 3 Bedroom Apt w. Two Car Spots
host_about: We love traveling and getting to see the world and meeting new friends. We live in Boston and love this city! If you ever stay in Boston you are welcome to check out our listing and we want to be the best hosts for you. Aside from work, we like to dine and wine, travel, hangout with friends, work out and do outdoor activities.

name: Central location North End/Waterfront 2Bedroom Apt
host_about: I love to travel, from New York City to Singapore and many places in between.  I travel with my husband, children and friends.  I have found that as I experience new cultures my own perspective on life changes.  My favorite city is Boston.  It has all the offerings of a big city with the feel of a small city with a heart.  We have culture, entertainment, shopping, restaurants galore, museums, galleries, history...

name: Back Bay/Fenway Place
host_about: I'm a married  engineer with my own business building factory automation and I have 11 rental apartments in Boston. Boston has been my home since starting school in 1975. I have not travelled much but my wife loves to and I'm eager to start.

name: Spacious 1 BR. Apt. in Allston - all to yourself!
host_about: I'm a masters student at Harvard studying global health. I'm also founding a non-profit in India that's scaling up text message reminders for moms to get their kids vaccinated. I'd describe myself as very extroverted and interested in hearing about other people but no pressure if you just need a bed to crash!

name: Victorian to Bauhaus, Penthouse of Hospitality
Angel’s room in Boston
host_about: Hi there, thanks for looking up my listing, I hope you like what you see. I have a beautiful inviting apartment around the corner from the red line in Boston and would love to welcome you during your holiday, relocation or visit. I also have a new home in Providence I am constantly updating. When not in Boston or Providence, I can be found on photo assignments all around New England. When not on assignments, decorating or hosting, I may be found roaming the four corners of the world. My favorite part of the world is South East Asia (I've spent multiple Winters in Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia, Japan, China, Myanmar, India, The Philippines and Indonesia to name a few ;)) and more recent trips have taken me to Guadeloupe, Panama, Colombia and various other Central and South American countries. I speak French, Spanish and English mostly and understand a few other languages; I love roaming the world, discovering new cultures and meeting new people. I started hosting on Airbnb in April 2016 and I am loving it and loving the privilege of hosting people from around the world! I can assure you that I will do my best to make sure your trip is as wonderful as it should be. I look forward to hearing from you and hopefully hosting you soon; don't hesitate to reach out or ask me anything. :)

name: 2 Bedroom 1 Bath - Beacon Hill Boston (145CH#3)
host_about:
Todd has been with Charlesgate Realty Group since 2004. As the General Manager of Charlesgate Realty, his primary roles are to hire and train staff, direct the sales and leasing operations, and consult key sales and leasing clients in the property management division. His guidance in all aspects of residential real estate make him an invaluable asset to our clients and the Charlesgate team.

Todd’s expertise and experience in the leasing industry in unparalleled. With twelve years of direct involvement in the Boston leasing market (both working with clients and training staff), our clients rely on his rental valuations and market knowledge to achieve their investment goals. He was instrumental in launching the initial growth and development of the Charlesgate Realty Leasing and Property Management division, which is now one of the most well regarded leasing and boutique property management firms in Boston. He has developed and refined the premier Boston agent training program that is utilized to train and develop successful Charlesgate agents.

By being active day to day in the market, Todd is able to maintain key expertise with the market while training, coaching and mentoring agents in the office. He currently serves on the Rental Issues Task Force for the Greater Boston Real Estate Board.

Todd has a B.A from UMass-Boston in economics.

name: Fun Boston condo all to yourselves! Enjoy!
host_about:
Easy going, professional guy living in Boston, MA.  Own a condo in East Boston that is close to everything.  Have family across the US that I travel to and visit with.  GLBT friendly here.  Into family, friends, working out, job, theater, movies, and church.

Five things I can't live without:  friends, healthy food, computer, almond butter, HP

Some favorite movies: Swiss Army Man, The Fault In Our Stars, The Matrix, Elf, Erin Brokovitch, Call Me By Your Name, Star Trek, Maurice, + more...

Newer to Airbnb.  Enjoying hosting a lot!  I'm neat, clean cut, organized, and low maintenance.

name: Charming South End | Back Bay | Copley Apartment
host_about:
We love to meet people from all over the world. Traveling is a passion of ours and we enjoy visiting different countries and learning about their culture.
We are serious animal lovers and have 5 rescue animals. Eventually, we would love to have a farm and rescue animals. :)

name: Private Room in Luxury Apartment
host_about:
Recent Harvard Graduate class of 2018 :) Master of Finance 

I am very down to earth, very friendly and always happy to help in any way that I can to make your stay as comfortable as possible in any one of my properties. I am only a message away :).

I was born and raised in Elizabeth, NJ and know the area very well, this is where most of my listings are located 5 minutes from EWR Newark Liberty International Airport. 

At the moment I split my time between New Jersey and Boston, Massachusetts and focusing more on being an entrepreneur rather than finding work. I truly love the Airbnb concept and hope to have listings all over the world some day :). I also have a car rental business that works on a similar platform as Airbnb called TURO. 

I am very interested in all Asian cultures and love meeting people from that part of the world. I hope to live there some day.  My family is from Ecuador and I have double citizenship for United States and Ecuador.

name: CHESTNUT ROOM ★ Chic & Large - 15 Mins to Downtown
host_about:
Hi there!

We are Boris and Susan - a young, professional couple living in Boston. 

I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

name: Boston Holiday Getaway
Cozy Studio in GREAT location (Downtown)
host_about:
I like to live to the fullest and seize the moment but can switch to being responsible on a moment's notice. I very much subscribe to the MIT "Work Hard, Play Hard" way of life. I enjoy beer and wine. I also enjoy aged rums and whiskeys on occasions. I love outdoor activities, including but not limited to hiking, backpacking, snowboarding, skiing, horseback riding, biking, running, kayaking, canoeing, and sailing. I love running but don't do it nearly as much as I woud like. I have played in sports teams throughout my life, including basketball, soccer, crew, and softball. One of my dreams is to go to space although for now I'll settle for looking at this wonderful planet from 8,848 m or below. I am very close to my family and fraternity brothers but I also love meeting new people and getting out of the routine. 

Interests
Fitness, Snowboarding, Cooking, Theoretical Physics, History, Yoga, Science Fiction, Anime, anything fun, interesting, and out of the ordinary

Philosophy
-Live every day like it's your last 
-Let your love be known 
-Choose compassion
-Accept that everyone is different but we are all part of the same global community 
-Help those in need 
-Smile. It might change someone's life

Music, Movies, Books
-Almost all music but prefer Classic Rock, EDM, Funk, Spanish Guitar, Blues, and Alternative Rock and electronic 
-Science fictions, fantasy books and movies. Historical novels and books are also high up there, and I also enjoy mind-bending and cerebral movies.
Types of People I enjoy
-People who are open-minded and are willing to share their life experiences.

Teach, Learn, Share
Based on my educational background, I can offer technical knowledge and network of technical people. I would like to learn more about business and entrepreneurship, especially small online businesses. I would also like to learn more about your spiritual beliefs and experiences if you are willing.

Somos Venezolanos nos encanta el café con leche y pan caliente.

name: Very comfortable place , go just 3 minuets Subway
Lux 1 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: BRONZE ROOM ★ Modern & Bright- 15 Mins to Downtown
host_about:
Hi there!

We are Boris and Susan - a young, professional couple living in Boston. 

I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

name: Lux 2 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

The Boston Christopher Grand Studio Suite
host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: ~*5 Min Walk to Subway*~ NOMAD
host_about:
Sena grew up in the South End neighborhood in Boston and Jovan was born and raised in Concord, MA, northwest of the city. We both attended college in the Boston area and, aside from a two year stint in New York City, have lived in Boston or the surrounding area all our lives. Sena is a former fashion designer turned fourth grade teacher in the nearby suburb of Needham and Jovan works in marketing for a toy company in Rhode Island. 

We love running, yoga, hiking, eating, baking, and throughout the years we’ve had the chance to visit many different countries including Japan, China, Thailand, Cambodia, Costa Rica, and Greece (staying at many Airbnb’s along the way). In the future we’d love to explore Mexico, Iceland, and more of Europe.

name: Colorful Private Room Available
host_about:
Hello!

I am a certified music therapist working in the Boston area.  I work primarily with older adults with dementia.  I love my job and am so happy to have a career that helps to spread the joy of music.  I play in an elecro-pop band and also have a solo folk project.  A few of my favorite artists are Bjork, Coco Rosie, Joanna Newsom, Grimes, and Erykah Badu.  I enjoy being involved in the local art and music scene.  I also love to spend time reading, cooking, hiking, going to the beach and painting clothes.  My three favorite places I have traveled to are Morocco, Thailand and Nepal.  I love to smile, and I love meeting new people.  :-)

We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: Sunny Studio in Boston's Central Beacon Hill
Modern 2br @ Prudential Ctr Back Bay & South end!
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! I love the movie The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles and The Animals. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 29 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your Boston stay, the best stay possible! Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and night life suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

name: Gorgeous 1 Bedroom Apartment! Furnished!

host_about:
I'm  a retired technology project manager who works 1/2 time as a volunteer for the Epilepsy Foundation of New England.  My daughter lives in Chapel Hill and we spend 3 - 4 months a year there.  When we are not using one of the two homes, we make it available for rent.  
We have also rented places through Airbnb and have often found that the places aren't nearly as nice as the pictures.  We are certain that if you rent from us, you'll find our two homes are exactly as they are pictured.  The Chapel HIll Condo is 2 1/2 years old and has been used for only 12 months and the Boston home has been updated and renovated so everything is in excellent condition.

Within a block of our Maverick Square building, you will find restaurants, pubs, bakeries, coffee shops, pizzerias, taquerias, atm machines, convenience stores and a post office. Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: Cozy room hosted by Rosana and family.
East Boston Apt-  Skyline Views & Close to Airport
Fort Hill Top - 1Fr - Guest Rm Jamaica Plain/Roxb
host_about:
Hi, we are Kevin & Fran, a married multicultural couple (US/Italian + German).
Kevin is a professional classical musician (he doesn't practice at home) - you can learn more at Kevin's website - si parla Inglese e l'Italiano.
Kevin's wife Fran is a German physician.

As we are transferring to Munich by July 1, 2019, we have Nik and Alessia (two post-docs, they are a couple and will move into the 4th bedroom (which is currently ours) on Aug 23 and stay for at least a year) as our long-term renters and AirBnB "surrogate hosts". For the other available bedrooms, the renters have been international researchers/postdocs/physicians that are looking for a quiet place to wind down after busy days and we look forward to continuing this tradition as this was always a great fit. 
Our friend Kellie lives in Boston(West Roxbury) and will manage everything locally (e.g. if something is not working properly). Kevin is anticipating to come to Boston every couple of months. Kellie and Kevin will both monitor the AirBnB messages.

name: ~*5 Min Walk to Subway*~ KISMET
host_about:
Sena grew up in the South End neighborhood in Boston and Jovan was born and raised in Concord, MA, northwest of the city. We both attended college in the Boston area and, aside from a two year stint in New York City, have lived in Boston or the surrounding area all our lives. Sena is a former fashion designer turned fourth grade teacher in the nearby suburb of Needham and Jovan works in marketing for a toy company in Rhode Island. 

We love running, yoga, hiking, eating, baking, and throughout the years we’ve had the chance to visit many different countries including Japan, China, Thailand, Cambodia, Costa Rica, and Greece (staying at many Airbnb’s along the way). In the future we’d love to explore Mexico, Iceland, and more of Europe.

name: Large Functional 2 B/B, Modern Building, Great Loc
host_about:
Our company, Boston Corporate Housing, has been hosting visitors, companies, doctors and patients, and much more for the past ten years. We provide short term housing across Boston in key areas. Our reputation for excellent customer service and luxury living is known to all our customers. Check out our 1 or 2 Bedroom/Bathroom apartments today!

Our Charles River Park locations are walking distance to Mass General Hospital (MGH), The Museum of Science, The TD Banknorth Garden, The North End, The Galleria Mall and much more. There is free ground transportation to all the other major hospitals in Boston as well.

Our Apartments in Longwood Area are  right by Brigham & Women’s Hospital, Dana Farber, Boston Children’s Hospital, Beth Israel, Mass Eye and Ear at Longwood, Harvard Medical/ Dental School and other Universities,  with nearby Parks and Recreation, Stop and Shop, Walgreens, Various Restaurants, Museum of Fine Arts. Green Line subway stations...

name: Chic Back Bay Penthouse & Deck Steps to Newbury St
host_about: I am a young professional working in real estate, who loves to travel & explore new places not only within New England but also all over the world. Been in Boston on and off about ten years now so I know all the good spots for dining out, shopping out, site seeing and even hiking. I love being able to pass this information on to guests so if you need recommendations or have any questions, I am available 24/7 by phone and email! Also, check out my Instagram @southendoasis & please tag it in photos during your trip!

2BR on sweetest street in the South End

name: Basic living for short term stay in Boston
host_about:
I have a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management and have been working in the hospitality industry for 04 years. I therefore believe that I have the knowledge and experience to create and offer you a pleasant stay at my place. I am  neat, meticulous, and professional. I value clear communication and punctuality.

I'm also extremly internationally-minded. I currently live and work in Boston. My home may not be an ideal place for those looking for a fancy or luxurious place but it is for those looking for a comfortable and cozy home. I will try my best to make your visit a wonderful experience.

name: Beautiful and Comfy . 1 Queen Bed
host_about:
My name is Carlos.I’m in the construction industry. I’m a plumber, I’ve been a plumber for the past 16 years a job and career I love.

 My place is located in the beautiful historical Dorchester located minutes away from the JFK library. My place is just steps away from the metro station, just a 10/15 minutes’ ride to downtown Boston, Back Bay, The Duck Boat Tour, TD Garden, The Freedom Trail, Black Heritage Trail, Faneuil Hall, John F. Kennedy Presidential Museum, and a 20 minutes’ ride to Harvard university and MIT university. 

 
My place is close to America Food Basket, gas station, free park, pizzeria for on the go dinning, Wine and spirits locations for social gathering and or dining. Easy access to Uber or lyft. 

My home is a beautiful 3-bedroom apartment with a nice living room, a huge kitchen and a lovely bathroom. The bedrooms are huge and spacious with extra closet space complete with cable TV, Netflix, and Wi Fi  throughout the entire home. My place will be perfect for you next trip to Boston. Cheers and happy travels and exploring.

name: Pretty Bedroom in Brighton, Boston: BC/BU/Harvard
host_about:
I am a working professional in the pharmaceutical industry in Boston, USA. I am happily  married and living in Boston with my husband and my wonderful dog, Gumbo. I love food, (cooking and eating)! I also am passionate about traveling across the world as much as possible (I never leave any vacation days behind)! I can't live without bread, my husband, my dog, or my family. 
My ideal holiday has a little bit of everything- some city sightseeing, but also some natural scenery mixed in. My husband and I enjoy getting to know our hosts and getting local advice from them if they live there too.

name: Back Bay on Marathon Home Straight!
Cozy two bedroom right across Mass General Hospt.
host_about:
Our company, Boston Corporate Housing, has been hosting visitors, companies, doctors and patients, and much more for the past ten years. We provide short term housing across Boston in key areas. Our reputation for excellent customer service and luxury living is known to all our customers. Check out our 1 or 2 Bedroom/Bathroom apartments today!

Our Charles River Park locations are walking distance to Mass General Hospital (MGH), The Museum of Science, The TD Banknorth Garden, The North End, The Galleria Mall and much more. There is free ground transportation to all the other major hospitals in Boston as well.

Our Apartments in Longwood Area are  right by Brigham & Women’s Hospital, Dana Farber, Boston Children’s Hospital, Beth Israel, Mass Eye and Ear at Longwood, Harvard Medical/ Dental School and other Universities,  with nearby Parks and Recreation, Stop and Shop, Walgreens, Various Restaurants, Museum of Fine Arts. Green Line subway stations...

We are serious animal lovers and have 5 rescue animals. Eventually, we would love to have a farm and rescue animals. :)

name: Luxury Loft
Lovely and Comfortable
host_about:
My name is Carlos.I’m in the construction industry. I’m a plumber, I’ve been a plumber for the past 16 years a job and career I love.

 My place is located in the beautiful historical Dorchester located minutes away from the JFK library. My place is just steps away from the metro station, just a 10/15 minutes’ ride to downtown Boston, Back Bay, The Duck Boat Tour, TD Garden, The Freedom Trail, Black Heritage Trail, Faneuil Hall, John F. Kennedy Presidential Museum, and a 20 minutes’ ride to Harvard university and MIT university. 

 
My place is close to America Food Basket, gas station, free park, pizzeria for on the go dinning, Wine and spirits locations for social gathering and or dining. Easy access to Uber or lyft. 

My home is a beautiful 3-bedroom apartment with a nice living room, a huge kitchen and a lovely bathroom. The bedrooms are huge and spacious with extra closet space complete with cable TV, Netflix, and Wi Fi  throughout the entire home. My place will be perfect for you next trip to Boston. Cheers and happy travels and exploring.

name: 2 Bed & 2 Bath Luxury Apartment in Fenway Park 301
host_about:
Full-service housing company that providing hassle-free solutions for domestic and international medical patients, students, interns, professionals, and short-term visitors.

All apartment units come fully furnished, include all amenities, and are conveniently located near Boston Children's Hospital,Massachusetts General Hospital,Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, and Joslin Diabetes Center,Harvard University,Boston University,Boston College,Northeastern University,Tufts University, Berklee College of Music,Lesley University and Kaplan International Colleges. We are all over Boston!

name: Duplex 5BR/2BH•11 Beds 4.6mi to Downtown stepsto T
Historic North End Apartment - 1 bedroom
Lux 2BR 2BA Apt w/rooftop deck, gym, WiFi
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Tranquility of Grove Hall
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, drinking responsibly, gambling in moderation, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! My favorite movie of all time is The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles, The Animals and Boston. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand and the Middle East. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 30 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your stay in Boston, the best stay possible! Your satisfaction and positive experience is of the utmost importance. Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and nightlife suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

name: A Bright Room in Veggie Paradise!
host_about:
Hello! I'm Myla, the founding member of a vegetarian coop house in Jamaica Plain, a lovely neighborhood of Boston. Our house is a 2 minute walk from the Orange Line (Forest Hills Station) and our neighborhood is walking distance from the Harvard Arboretum, Forest Hills Cemetery, Jamaica Pond, and plenty of restaurants, local retail shops, and bars. There's nice running and walking locations nearby including the Arboretum, Forest Hills Cemetery (has some famous graves!) and Franklin Park, plus Jamaica Pons is just over a mile walk/run. 

I work from home for a dance non-profit, so am usually around to let in guests, deal with any house issues, or show you around!

name: Beautiful Cozy Apartment | Minutes to Downtown
host_about: I work a corporate job in Investment Management. In my free to time I love to explore Boston and other cities through out the North East traveling with friends.

name: Luxury apartment★walk to Fenway Park★Free Parking
Stunning Modern apartment in Back Bay!
Comfortable 1 BD East Boston apartment
host_about: I am a young profesional working in a technology company as Business Developer Manager in the city of Boston.

name: Sleek and Modern Apt in South End
host_about: I’m a free spirited, travel lover! I find Airbnb to have the perfect accommodations, better than hotels, for great prices. I love meeting new people in new places and falling in love with different cultures and cuisines.

name: Bright & Relaxing 2 Bedroom Apartment
host_about:
Isaac is an architectural designer who is devoted to sustainability and the practice of green architecture. He began his dedication to sustainability when he moved to Boston, where he was to start his career at The Boston Architectural College under a Bachelor of Sustainable Design. Isaac is a multi-disciplinary designer whose work focuses on architecture and sustainable design.

3 things I cannot live without:

-My phone: Unfortunately (fortunately?) I fully embrace being connected, I love social media because I have friends all across the world, and it helps me stay in touch with people I care about.

-A good book (or 5) I'm currently reading: I like being immersed in a book. Lately, I've been reading a lot of non-fiction, but I love a good fantasy book to lose myself within.

-A good pair of headphones: I've been listening to a lot of podcasts lately, especially while I'm doing work that might be a little more tedious, or when I'm driving. 

My style of traveling: I'm not a huge planner; while traveling I like to plan for one thing to do per day, and just go wander for the rest of the day. Food is essential; it doesn't have to be fancy, but I love experiencing authentic local food and drinks

name: COMFORTABLE PLACE IN ROSLINDALE
Chic North End Loft in Boston's Little Italy
host_about:
Hey there! I'm a young professional working in Boston. I work full time and am in grad school, but don't think I'm all work and no play! In my free time I'm an avid reader, trivia-goer, boxer, and devoted amateur player of basketball, chess, piano, and guitar (which you'll see evidence of if you stay in my lovely abode)!

Hoping to provide a welcoming space for you while you explore the big city - let me know if there's anything I can do to take your stay from "great" to "amazing".

name: Downtown Theater District & Boston Common Park
host_about:
Hi, My name is KJ! 
I have lived in Boston since 2011! Love this city and love to host travelers coming here. I went to Yonsei University in Korea, earned my bachelor's degree in Classical Piano. Then, I moved to Boston and graduated from Boston University in 2013 - got a Master of Music Degree. Boston is now my home and am working as a freelance pianist and sometimes as a tour guide!

I love exercising, playing jazz, meeting people, dancing, laying on the beach drinking cold beer, shopping and travel ;)
Nice to meet you all!!

name: Modern convenience in central Boston location
host_about: I'm a teacher and potter originally from Maine, now living in Boston.

name: Perfect Loft Apartment - Convenient  to Boston.
Sunny condo on tree-lined street (long-term stay)
comfortable and cozy
Oak Square Whole Apartment
Cozy Apt next to Logan Airport - Short/Long Stay
Cozy Colonial (entire home) near Lower Mills
host_about:
I am a father of two young boys (ages 10 and 6yrs), and I work in the holistic health field as a practitioner and educator. I travel frequently with my boys and, sometimes, I travel solo when continuing my studies with my teachers and mentors. It is in these cases that Airbnb particularly serves my interests. I like sports of all kinds, any music with a soul, and locally produced food, art, and products of all kinds.
The thing I most can't live without is hot water with lemon in the morning. Other than that, I might go so far as to say that I NEED fresh eggs, chips & salsa,  a craft beer or two, and a pillow under my head and another on my chest. As a guest, I like to think I'm fairly low maintenance and try to offer more to my hosts than what I require of them. Either way, I am happy to be a joiner or lock myself away in isolation.

name: ★Prime studio near Back Bay T! 28 night minimum
host_about: Hello! I'm Liesl - and yes, my mother was a fan of "The Sound of Music"! Originally from New Jersey, I came to Boston for college and after a couple years living in Europe, I returned to make my home here. I've lived in Fenway, Beacon Hill, the South End and currently live in Jamaica Plain with my husband and two sons, aged 10 and 12. Many years working in the travel industry have given me a great background for my move to the hospitality industry. I love working with travelers and we've had guests from all over the world - so interesting to hear their stories and what brings them to Boston. I would love to host you and give you all the inside info about what makes Boston a great place to visit!

name: Private Room and Bath in a Modern Unit
Melville Park Penthouse
host_about: I'm an adventurous and inquisitive Michigander transplanted to Boston and enjoying the concerts in the city. My partner Hammad and I settled here after traveling around the world for half a year, wandering west from Japan and eventually ending up in the Incan ruins of Peru. I love to sing and dance and hike up mountains. I work as an architect during the day then fill my evenings with board games, good cooking, and making music.

host_about:
Welcome to our profile, and allow us to introduce ourselves! For over twenty years, Maverick Suites has been providing boutique furnished apartments amongst brownstones all over Boston! We know the magic of this city, and love being a short-term stay for travelers from all across the globe. For the past three years, we have offered 80 of our units to Airbnb adventurers, and have had well-over thousands of stays! With studios across the city, stay on Newbury Street, the South End, Beacon Hill or Coolidge Corner depending on your travel plans.

Fueled by native, passionate team members, our team is here to provide an affordable and accommodating stay every time. Abbi, Mohammed, and Andrea are here to help answer any question or concern within minutes! Sometimes, you just can't get the AC to turn on. We get it. Every issue, every question, every restaurant recommendation (we have plenty), we want to assist you!

Sincerely,
The Cool Neighbors (Maverick Suites)

The Misses works in transportation planning and managing our little family and the Mr. works with ROBOTS!  We both LOVE LOVE LOVE cities and all the excitement they provide.  In our spare time we do lots of cooking, gardening, working on our old home, crafting and competitive/ recreational bike riding.  

When we stay at AirBNB places we make sure to be great guest!  That is, we are respectful of privacy, are in touch if we are going to be arriving late, etc... and make sure to keep the places where we stay as tidy as when we arrived. 

We look forward to meeting you as either a guest in our home, or a guest in yours!  If you stay in our home, you are either staying in the private apartment or in our side of the house.  This is our primary residence, so we provide the same levels of comfort to guest as we would like for ourselves!
