Before you come in to our home we will make sure that everything looks just about perfect for you.  We always try to meet you in person if our schedule permits , so we can  welcome you with a big smile.  and make you feel like Home!
         My husband and I  travel on regular basis for work, we know what it feels like to be a guest at someone's  home... So when you are a guest in our home, we will do our best for  you to  have the time of your life!

*****
    We have civilian security cameras in common areas and front doors of the building for everyone's protection. 
We speak English, Spanish and Portuguese.
  *******
Absolutely no parties or events  allowed. This is my personal home. I live in the building with family .  This is a family home and we want to keep it this way. Looking forward in having you  along with your friends and family to enjoy Boston and our Peaceful home.

name: ~*5 Min Walk to Subway*~ SOLSTICE
host_about:
Sena grew up in the South End neighborhood in Boston and Jovan was born and raised in Concord, MA, northwest of the city. We both attended college in the Boston area and, aside from a two year stint in New York City, have lived in Boston or the surrounding area all our lives. Sena is a former fashion designer turned fourth grade teacher in the nearby suburb of Needham and Jovan works in marketing for a toy company in Rhode Island. 

We love running, yoga, hiking, eating, baking, and throughout the years we’ve had the chance to visit many different countries including Japan, China, Thailand, Cambodia, Costa Rica, and Greece (staying at many Airbnb’s along the way). In the future we’d love to explore Mexico, Iceland, and more of Europe.

name: Historic Getaway in Charlestown
host_about:
I moved to Victoria via Calgary and Prince Edward Island.  I guess being Island  born (Prince Edward Island) explains why I am so drawn to the ocean..... and this ocean doesn't freeze!   My family moved to Calgary for the  booming economy in 2003. Once I finished high school, I moved to Victoria because I love kiteboarding and spent quite a bit of time in Victoria riding my bike for training camps with my team. There are many great cycling routes and paths to explore.  Whether it be the dense forest, vast ocean, rugged mountains, or vibrant city, Victoria offers everything I admire in a place to call my home. I look forward to sharing my knowledge of the city, whether you are returning to Victoria for business or vacation, or coming for the first time.

I also run a Airbnb in Golden, BC! 
My family bought a "cabin" here in 2007, we have enjoyed years of use at this cabin. Now that our family is getting older, we dont use the cabin as much anymore, but we love sharing it with others! It is located 8km south of Golden, in an ideal location for Mountain Biking, XC skiing, Snowmobiling, Para-Gliding and so many other awesome outdoor activities!

name: Steps to Jamaica Pond / Emerald Necklace (Boston)
host_about: I am Canadian mother of three who has lived in Brookline/Boston, MA for 21 years.  I work as a part time physical therapist.  I know the Boston area well.  I have teenagers, so can make tourist recommendations for both adults and kids of all ages. I have enjoyed much of what Boston and the New England area has to offer. I enjoy outdoor recreation and am familiar with much of Boston's outdoor entertainment venues.  In the summer there are so many great free outdoor concerts which I'd be glad to help you navigate.

host_about:
A Chinese couple, have been living in Boston 25 years, we do speaking Chinese and English;  we are very friendly, I like dancing, swimming ;cooking; traveling , making new friends .  my husband likes Ping Pong and Swimming, he does maintenance and I do more customer services, and marketing. I was interpreter in China, I gained associated degrees in tourism English and international accounting in China. 

I have been as an accountant in the USA for more than twenty years. A very  enthusiastic person, always trying the best helping others friends said. 

Our motto: reputation brings revenue.

name: 5⭐ Couples Flat in Gaslight District + Parking
host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

name: Boston Commons Condos 1BD 1
host_about:
We are a passionate team running a modern tech-enabled corp housing co that believes nicely furnished high end homes should be consistent, affordable and easy to book. 

All our homes are professionally managed, meeting the mark on being clean, well-stocked, having a more or less consistent look and feel, priced below a comparable hotel for an extended stay, and 24/7 SMS support by a virtual concierge team.

name: JP this WINTER, One Bedroom, MONTHLY Discounts!
host_about:
Hi my name is Drew; I am a hospitality professional with a passion for eating, cooking, travelling and meeting new people. It brings me great pleasure to host guests in home around Boston through Airbnb. I'm great at showing guests a great and welcoming time while they visit this great City. 

If you're moving to Massachusetts, I'd love to help you find a new home to rent or own. Why not stay in one of our South End Hospitality's Airbnb properties while I show you some options? 

If you'd like to see my other listings please message me and I look forward to you staying with me.

name: 2nd Floor with Everything
host_about:
I love being an Airbnb host because of the opportunity it offers to meet wonderful people from around the world, and provide them with homes while they live in our country. Over 90% of my guests rent the apartments sight unseen and I feel honored by the trust they put in us and take the responsibility seriously. Our guests are dynamic and seeking people and it is a always a pleasure to meet them.

I enjoy making and sharing beautiful places. This building is a one of a kind Victorian gem built with an attention to detail rarely seen .  Each of these apartments offer the same level of comfort, with its on special features.  I could not say which one of the apartments is my favorite, I love them all.   

Professionally I work as an architect and construction manager specializing in re-use and re-purposing places and objects.  I value re-using materials and repairing whenever possible, while providing the highest standards for convenience.   This building is an ever changing place in a special location.  Your time spent in the South End will be a rich experience, for many reasons this is a place to form happy memories.

I enjoy traveling and like our guests would like to visit places months at a time, but have not had the time to do so in year.

name: East Boston - Jeffries Point  Entire Guest Suite
host_about: You only live once!

name: TOP Floor 2 Bd w/Elevator & Views on Freedom Trail

host_about:
Hello nomads, travel enthusiasts, and adventurers!

I’ve resided in the amazing city of Boston for eight years and am originally from Southern California. I know the city like the back of my hand, and would be more than happy to answer any questions you may have, and share my  recommendations for making the most of your Boston visit!

In my free time I love traveling, immersing myself in different cultures, going to music events, working out, and cooking healthy & delicious foods.

host_about: Kevin and Leigha live and work in Boston, Kevin is a lifelong resident of Boston.  Part of our business is property management so our properties are always well maintained and in the unlikely event a guest has an issue we are equipped to deal with whatever the issue is promptly and professionally.  We love our city and our neighborhood, we enjoy sharing our favorite places to eat and visit with guests. We enjoy traveling ourselves, our most recent adventures took us to Cuba and Ireland, as well as ski trips to Wyoming and Utah.

name: In-Law apartment-walking distance to Longwood Area
host_about: I am so looking forward to hosting you in my home!  I love being home, but also travel frequently for both business and pleasure.  As a seasoned traveler, I know what I need and love in a lodging.  I will do my best to bring that experience to you.  Adventure travel is my favorite, and I have been to many incredible destinations -- Antarctica, Galapagos Islands, Safaris in Zambia, Botswana and Namibia -- are highlights.  I've worked and lived for 1 year in Lusaka, Zambia.  I also love travelling to US cities to visit family -  Cincinnati, Pittsburgh, Omaha - all great to visit because of the friends and family that live there.  But there is no place like home, and I love coming home every time!

host_about:
I am an MIT alum and a tech entrepreneur. Having traveled and worked in many cities across continents, I've been an Airbnb host and a guest many times! 

I love to welcome people to one of my favorite cities, Boston, and show them around. Feel free to ask me any questions!

name: Sunny and Cozy 2 BR Apartment
host_about:
We are a family of four from Boston, MA. We are loyal Bostonians living in the heart of the city, born and raised  We are 15 minutes from all of the tourist destinations by train or car to the Back Bay, Downtown, Fenway and other popular locations. 

We are a fun, loving and welcoming bunch. We encourage all to venture to Boston and enjoy urban living, commuting on the subway and to immerse in all things Boston beyond tourist destinations. 

Inbox us with any questions. We are happy to assist and provide recommendations.

name: 2 Private Rooms in Shared, Spacious JP home
host_about:
We are a married couple in our late 30's with a young family that includes a slowing down, but still lively 9 year old Australian Cattle Dog and three little girls.  Our home is LQBTQIA friendly!  The Misses works in transportation planning and managing our little family and the Mr. works with ROBOTS!  We both LOVE LOVE LOVE cities and all the excitement they provide.  In our spare time we do lots of cooking, gardening, working on our old home, crafting and competitive/ recreational bike riding.  

When we stay at AirBNB places we make sure to be great guest!  That is, we are respectful of privacy, are in touch if we are going to be arriving late, etc... and make sure to keep the places where we stay as tidy as when we arrived. 

We look forward to meeting you as either a guest in our home, or a guest in yours!  If you stay in our home, you are either staying in the private apartment or in our side of the house.  This is our primary residence, so we provide the same levels of comfort to guest as we would like for ourselves!

host_about:
Our company, Boston Corporate Housing, has been hosting visitors, companies, doctors and patients, and much more for the past ten years. We provide short term housing across Boston in key areas. Our reputation for excellent customer service and luxury living is known to all our customers. Check out our 1 or 2 Bedroom/Bathroom apartments today!

Our Charles River Park locations are walking distance to Mass General Hospital (MGH), The Museum of Science, The TD Banknorth Garden, The North End, The Galleria Mall and much more. There is free ground transportation to all the other major hospitals in Boston as well.

Our Apartments in Longwood Area are  right by Brigham & Women’s Hospital, Dana Farber, Boston Children’s Hospital, Beth Israel, Mass Eye and Ear at Longwood, Harvard Medical/ Dental School and other Universities,  with nearby Parks and Recreation, Stop and Shop, Walgreens, Various Restaurants, Museum of Fine Arts. Green Line subway stations...

name: Lux 2BR 1BA Apt w/rooftop deck, gym, WiFi
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Great time to visit Boston! Adorable 1BR Condo.
host_about:
Easy going, professional guy living in Boston, MA.  Own a condo in East Boston that is close to everything.  Have family across the US that I travel to and visit with.  GLBT friendly here.  Into family, friends, working out, job, theater, movies, and church.

Five things I can't live without:  friends, healthy food, computer, almond butter, HP

Some favorite movies: Swiss Army Man, The Fault In Our Stars, The Matrix, Elf, Erin Brokovitch, Call Me By Your Name, Star Trek, Maurice, + more...

Newer to Airbnb.  Enjoying hosting a lot!  I'm neat, clean cut, organized, and low maintenance.

name: Light-Filled Gorgeous New Luxury Apartment
Spacious 1BR in Prime Historic Boston
Private & Elegant Room with Double Beds in Boston
North End Large Studio With Private Roof Deck
host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: Private Room with a Queen Bed in Boston Area
Gorgeous 18H villa near Harvard University
Private Suite in Luxury Apartment
host_about:
Recent Harvard Graduate class of 2018 :) Master of Finance 

I am very down to earth, very friendly and always happy to help in any way that I can to make your stay as comfortable as possible in any one of my properties. I am only a message away :).

I was born and raised in Elizabeth, NJ and know the area very well, this is where most of my listings are located 5 minutes from EWR Newark Liberty International Airport. 

At the moment I split my time between New Jersey and Boston, Massachusetts and focusing more on being an entrepreneur rather than finding work. I truly love the Airbnb concept and hope to have listings all over the world some day :). I also have a car rental business that works on a similar platform as Airbnb called TURO. 

I am very interested in all Asian cultures and love meeting people from that part of the world. I hope to live there some day.  My family is from Ecuador and I have double citizenship for United States and Ecuador.

name: Boston Condominium

name: Charming JP Apartment
host_about:
Hi Fellow Travelers!
 
I am Joanna, a current candidate in a Master’s program in Sustainable International Development at Brandeis! As a student in an international program, I truly value traveling in addition to music and other hobbies involving exploring the world. I believe Airbnb is a great platform for anyone who wants to travel and enjoys visiting different places and cultures! 
 
I've lived in Spain, grew up in North Carolina, and now consider myself a Bostonian. My home in South Boston is very comfortable and right next the beach where I enjoy jogging in the mornings! I would like to share my place while I'm Airbnbing since I believe my home will bring happiness and a true Boston experience :) 
 
When I'm not traveling or studying, I enjoy nonfiction books such as "A New Earth Awakening" By Eckhart Tolle or simply relaxing at the beach near Castle Island. 
 
As a host, I will do my best to provide you with a very comfortable stay in my home and provide with the very best tips for visiting Boston. As a guest, I will respect your home and truly appreciate the space given to me.

name: 5⭐ Business Travel Retreat + 2 Bedrooms + Parking
host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

name: Perfect Room in the South End for solo adventurer
HARBOR VIEW/Chic Top Flr 1 Bd/North End/Frdm Trail
1A south end, sunny room w/bath near T/BU Medical
Luxury 3bd/2ba Townhouse S. Boston, BCEC, Seaport
Downtown Boston, Near South Station Bus Terminal
host_about:
Allow me to introduce myself, my name is Ping and I welcome you to our newly renovated apartment! 

If there is anything I would like to share, it would be my love for food. I especially have an fondness for coffee and tea in particular. There is nothing more relaxing and calming then to read an book while enjoying an cup of coffee. 

One of the many perks about staying at this area is that it's close to the aquarium and the harbor to enjoy some nice seafood. If you're an museum-type, I would suggest some of the many museums here. The closest one would be the Children's Museum!

name: Li’l Italy, *Harbor apartment. Spacious*
host_about:
Dave & I have lived in Boston for 13 years and have been hosting guests for over 23 years. We have been Airbnb hosts since March of 2016. Prior to living in Boston, we worked together with Nonprofit relief agencies throughout the world. Some of those places include the  Philippines, Indonesia, Nicaragua, Pakistan, China and more. The North End makes us feel right at home as it has an international feel with so many countries represented.  We enjoy riding our Harley Davidson motorcycle, reading, time at the lake and our 7 children and 8 grandchildren.
We now pastor the church here and love our neighborhood and our beautiful city. In our line of work we meet lots of people and look forward to meeting you as well.

Please let me know if you have any suggestions for us on how we can make guests happier, and I look forward to having you stay at our place. Thanks!

host_about:
Our company, Boston Corporate Housing, has been hosting visitors, companies, doctors and patients, and much more for the past ten years. We provide short term housing across Boston in key areas. Our reputation for excellent customer service and luxury living is known to all our customers. Check out our 1 or 2 Bedroom/Bathroom apartments today!

Our Charles River Park locations are walking distance to Mass General Hospital (MGH), The Museum of Science, The TD Banknorth Garden, The North End, The Galleria Mall and much more. There is free ground transportation to all the other major hospitals in Boston as well.

Our Apartments in Longwood Area are  right by Brigham & Women’s Hospital, Dana Farber, Boston Children’s Hospital, Beth Israel, Mass Eye and Ear at Longwood, Harvard Medical/ Dental School and other Universities,  with nearby Parks and Recreation, Stop and Shop, Walgreens, Various Restaurants, Museum of Fine Arts. Mount Restwell
host_about: I am a working musician/artist who finds balance in Real Estate development and improvement.   I am a proud father of two boys and I live in a huge 5 bedroom Victorian.    I like to eat quality food, spend time with mother nature and genuine smiles.  Priceless.

name: Lemon Drop 1: verdant retreat 7 min walk to subway
host_about:
I'm a freelance journalist, and nowadays I write mostly about information security, technology careers, diabetes and other health issues. I work from home, so I'm usually here to help my guests out in any way I can. My boyfriend, John, lives here, and if I'm not here to welcome you and give you tips on enjoying Boston, he'll do the honors!

I'm mad about organic gardening, used to keep bees but don't anymore, and my yard is a jungle full of birds and fruit that I wish the birds would let me eat.

I grow things. The garden is one of the best things about this house. It's gotten a little insane. Growth is a little rampant. It might eat you before you reach the front door. I apologize. Send up a flare!

Some of the most amazing times in my life have come about through traveling or hosting travelers to this beautiful city. I love meeting new people, hearing about their adventures, learning more about where they come from, and helping them have a wonderful time here in Boston. 

I've had Thai people help me count the steps out loud in Thai when visiting  a mountain temple in Chiang Mai. I've kayaked from Cambridge, down the Charles River, through the locks, out into Boston Harbor, and into a dock outside The Barking Crab restaurant for a lunch of fried clams—a local favorite! I've been to New Orleans to work with Habitat for Humanity in rebuilding after Hurricane Katrina. I've hiked the White Mountains. I've trekked France, I've studied Spanish in Madrid, I've tossed bread crumbs to fish in Greece. 

Come to Boston, and I'll do everything I can to make sure you make wonderful new travel memories here, dining under my grape arbor, visiting your children's college, walking the Freedom Trail or whatever else you wind up doing!

name: Spacious Room near the Subway
host_about:
Hey,

I'm from Dublin, Ireland and moved to Boston 6 years ago. 

Loved to travel around Europe and always enjoyed the hostels we stayed in! After moving to the states I have tended to remain up here in the North East, travelling around Massachusetts to New Hampshire up to Canada - generally on the hunt for good skiing.

While in Boston I try to balance things out between working away as a code monkey and trying to pull together a startup. With a few hours still going to waste, I've gone back to school with evening classes up in Harvard Extension. 

I love having friends over - I'll throw together some random event, be it Johnny Appleseed Cider Fest or a Spaceballs movie night. Something to get friends together. 

I've had a few guests now and I'm still trying to nail this hosting business - going from just ensuring the place is clean and tidy to trying to see how I can make your trip more enjoyable. Always open to suggestions!

name: 2 Bedroom Standard- Monthly
host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: 5⭐ City Safari in City Square + 2 Bedrooms+Parking
host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

name: Historic Charm PVT Entry/Bath Keyless Cont BFast!
host_about: Third generation South Bostonian. History buff and Irish music devotee. Experienced business and leisure travelers.  Past owners of a travel agency, and c level business exec.  We bring our experience and expectations of a welcoming accommodation to our two suites for you to enjoy.

name: Lemon Drop 2: verdant retreat 7 min walk to subway
host_about:
I'm a freelance journalist, and nowadays I write mostly about information security, technology careers, diabetes and other health issues. I work from home, so I'm usually here to help my guests out in any way I can. My boyfriend, John, lives here, and if I'm not here to welcome you and give you tips on enjoying Boston, he'll do the honors!

I'm mad about organic gardening, used to keep bees but don't anymore, and my yard is a jungle full of birds and fruit that I wish the birds would let me eat.

I grow things. The garden is one of the best things about this house. It's gotten a little insane. Growth is a little rampant. It might eat you before you reach the front door. I apologize. Send up a flare!

Some of the most amazing times in my life have come about through traveling or hosting travelers to this beautiful city. I love meeting new people, hearing about their adventures, learning more about where they come from, and helping them have a wonderful time here in Boston. 

I've had Thai people help me count the steps out loud in Thai when visiting  a mountain temple in Chiang Mai. I've kayaked from Cambridge, down the Charles River, through the locks, out into Boston Harbor, and into a dock outside The Barking Crab restaurant for a lunch of fried clams—a local favorite! I've been to New Orleans to work with Habitat for Humanity in rebuilding after Hurricane Katrina. I've hiked the White Mountains. I've trekked France, I've studied Spanish in Madrid, I've tossed bread crumbs to fish in Greece. 

Come to Boston, and I'll do everything I can to make sure you make wonderful new travel memories here, dining under my grape arbor, visiting your children's college, walking the Freedom Trail or whatever else you wind up doing!

name: ★Modern Cabin Style | minutes to airport+downtown★
host_about:
Thank you so much for visiting my property! I take pride in maintaining every aspect of my rentals. As you can see I want to make sure my guests have the upmost positive experience possible. I am outgoing and try to accommodate every guest on a personal and professional level. The key to a successful business is knowing your clientele. I work hard to do so and believe you will appreciate the effort I put in to make you feel at home.

I have been married for 35 years, and have 3 kids, 2 girls, and 1 boy. I am a family oriented person who is meticulous and responsive. When you stay as a guest with me if you ever need anything, I am always available to help you. I started from the bottom and worked my way up so I know the value of hard work. We want you to feel like you're at home when you stay with us. I promise you that you will use my location again and again! My wife and I have experience with renting and real estate as an investor so we know what it takes to please guests.

name: Newly updated 1 bedroom, walk to Ashmont T!
host_about:
I am a loving, adoring dog and cat mom, and recently, a doting 'step mother' to my husband's chickens.  

By day and trade, I'm a psychiatric nurse practitioner with a specialty in child/adolescent mental health.  It is an immensely rewarding position and my life is enriched with all the' feels' because of it.  I am so grateful.  

My husband and I mostly use Air BNB to 'get away', even just to leave town to go nowhere in particular.  We have had some of our best times together in Maine or Vermont in others' beautiful country homes.  I plan detailed, time-efficient and creative itineraries for us to enjoy everything that areas have to offer.  We especially enjoy the very local dive places, farm tours,  and wineries.  My husband is easygoing, fun, adventurous, and the most loyal, kind friend anyone could ever imagine.  I am very lucky.  

I rent a place out on air bnb and rent from others.  I'm an excellent guest and host. :)

name: Spacious Jamaica Plain destination!
host_about: I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband, sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts, is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding, jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making, live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups, birthday parties, bachelorette parties, make your own wedding bands, create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

I speak English, French, & Creol . Boston has been my home for 8 years and I love living here. I have two listings, one in Boston and my parents suite in Québec, Canada. Feel free to ask me questions! I can give suggestions on sight-seeing areas and all the great spots for food/entertainment for both towns.

My interests are: Slacklining (walking tightropes), beach-volleyball, playing music, cooking, yoga, long boarding, dance,  ultimate frisbee, playing board games/improv games, cycling, handstands! Lots and lots of handstands!!

name: Central Boston  5 Bed 2 Bath North End-Sleeps 10
A historic home near Longwood & NEU
host_about:
A little more about me: I was born near Boston to a family that arrived in the 1920s from Ireland. I live within one mile of my grandparents' first rented apartments.  I'm still close to a rather large extended family and network of friends throughout the Boston area.  We have loved being here, for 3 generations in a row. In my professional life I am a health policy researcher and professor of medicine in Boston. Outside of family and work, my interests include art, architecture, and music. 

Walking distance: 
Fort Hill and Highland Park are great for walking. In the mornings, head up to a revolutionary war fort (5 minutes) and an 1875 water standpipe that brought city plumbing to Roxbury. Eliot Square a few blocks away is home to an classic New England 1805 church, the oldest surviving wood structure church in the city. Walk 10 minutes to Dudley Square in one direction or Roxbury Crossing and the orange line MBTA subway Stationen the other. 

Short distance by subway or cab:
We are located within three subway stops of the Boston Symphony Orchestra (Andris Nelsons conducting is not to be missed), and 10 minutes by cab to the Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. We are within four subway stops of Copley Square, the Pru, South End Restaurants and cafes, shopping on Newbury and Charles Streets, Boston Public Gardens. You are staying in one of Boston's most exciting neighborhoods on one of its best streets.

If you want to explore Cambridge, Fenway Park, Harvard, MIT, the North End, the Boston Aquarium, Olmsted's Emerald Necklace, the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston Harbor (the "hahbah") or wherever your travel guide takes you, this home is located centrally. 

I hope you fall in love with my beautiful home and city during your visit.

host_about:
I'm Emilio, a working professional (public high school teacher.) I am offering two large rooms to traveling guests. Prior to being a high school teacher, I was a tennis instructor and I traveled to various islands in the Caribbean working (as a visiting tennis pro) and vacationing.

As a host I can be a lot active over the summer months,  a bit active during the school year, but mainly uninvolved since I'm busy being a classroom teacher, husband, and father to two little boys.  I am happy to provide clean, safe, and convenient accommodations for those visiting Boston.

name: Excellent Location in the Back Bay! (w/ Parking)
host_about: I am a big traveler and love to discover the local flavor of any place I visit. Born and raised north of Boston, but lived most my adult life in the DC area. Moved back  to Boston a couple years ago and have loved the continued transformation of such a historically rich city. So much has changed from my grandparents Boston to what you’ll experience today and it is all so exciting. The food, entertainment, arts, sports, shopping, outdoors, indoors...there is an energy in the city that is hard to miss. I am pretty open person and try to immerse myself in the local culture or at least the hit some of the local bars, restaurants, markets, etc. I hope you enjoy the city and everything it has to offer. I typically experience new places by hitting the street via walking or running and Boston couldn’t be better city for just that. I hope you enjoy the city as much as I do. Have fun!!

name: (6-4) Luxury Apartment, South End, Boston Medical!
(6-2) Three Beds, South End, Boston Medical!
Boston Retreat
Spectacular, luxury Bay Village/Back Bay Condo
host_about:
I'm what I'd call a young professional - although growing older every day. I'm married to a great woman and we've got an incredibly cute little daughter. I'm pretty much a work-o-holic.  I love my job -- I currently lead the Worldwide Sales team for a really interesting commercial open source company called Acquia.  Acquia provides support and cloud based platform services for Drupal - which powers over a million websites.

I would classify myself as a "driver." My favorite three words: "Sense of Urgency." I am skewed toward the "right brain" way of thinking. I'm passionate. I work beyond my boiling point at whatever task I'm setting out to achieve. I'm an anxious person. I'm a maverick. I'm a multi-tasker (the guy with two phones in hand, the PDA spitting e-mails and three lines on hold), sometimes to the point where my loved ones think I have ADD. I hate to lose, and rarely do. I love to exercise. I have terrible directional sense and it frustrates my friends and wife - so they just offer to drive now :-) I'm extremely dedicated to my family, relationships, profession and hobbies. Loyalty is something my Father taught me - and it will be forever ingrained in me.

Dawn

We love Airbnb both as a host and guest and have stayed in some fabulous properties. Being a host myself I understand how important good guests are and always try and be one.

The Perkins Inn is a small B&B in Jamaica Plain, 3 miles from the city center of Boston. The neighborhood is full of many private cafes, bars and next to the Longwood medical center and primary hospitals in Boston.

We offer free snacks, coffee and tea all day and a fresh cooked breakfast daily with each room. 

We look forward to hosting you soon.

We love to meet people from all over the world. Traveling is a passion of ours and we enjoy visiting different countries and learning about their culture.
We are serious animal lovers and have 5 rescue animals. Eventually, we would love to have a farm and rescue animals. :)

name: Puddingstone 45
host_about:
Paramount in my life is being happy; absolutely everything else is secondary-- it is a very fulfilling experience.

Hosting and meeting people from all over the world is amazing- it makes me happy also; it is incredible what technology has allowed us to achieve in this way, here it is actually bringing people together.  Since I started hosting guests with Air' I have established some of the most spectacular friendships, exceeding my expectations.  It is this unique chemistry between the guest and host that makes this interaction so fulfilling.  Curiosity, knowledge building, experience, kindness, intrigue, diversity and necessity all play a part.  To all guest past and future.... thank you.   

Enjoy writing, photography, reading, research, traveling, sailing and diving and cycling.  Former restaurant owner.  Volunteer, supporting community efforts and local business. Environmentalist; currently working on a book(Peering into the Future).

name: Comfort inn in my home

name: Beautiful Home★Walk to subway★Free parking
host_about: I have been living in Boston for years since college and I love this city! That is the main reason why I want to share my wonderful experience in Boston to anyone who's visiting here! As a host I'm doing my best to ensure all guests are staying comfortably and get to know the local Bostoners' life. Don't hesitate to ask if you have any questions!

name: 3 bed condo
host_about: Real Estate Broker/ P&C Agent

name: Bed, Bath and Beyond in Jamaica Plain
host_about:
Welcome!

I moved to Boston nine years ago after having lived for more than 30 years in three different countries on as many continents.  I have a passion for travelling  and, since my migration to Boston, have so enjoyed the experience of hosting other travelers through Airbnb (in addition to a non-paying website.)  I love that people from vastly different corners of the world and its multiple paths  arrive on my doorstep; I also love being of service, and sharing my resources (including my cats. :-)

I'm an educator, artist, (vegetarian) cook, polyglot, nature-lover, film aficionado, social-justice activist, and mother to three enchanting fur-people.  I try my modest best to live with care, consciousness and compassion.  My nest is my castle and, whether you're here on holiday, or for a work gig,  I would hope that it's a kind of "home away from home" for you.

name: Entire top floor of apartment

name: Boston Luxury Suites Cottage for 24 guests!
host_about: I work in the hotel industry and I like to travel. I love meeting new people and learning more about different places and cultures. At my property you will find all smallest details thoroughly thought though and taken care of. Welcome to your home away from home!

name: Rosi Comfort
Bright Spacious Condo Near Airport & Downtown
Private Garden Apartment sleeps up to four.
host_about: We are a married gay couple with three kids.  They are 19, 16, & 5. We enjoy traveling and getting to know people and their cultures from around the world. We have hosted many students over the years who were studying in Boston and started hosting with Airbnb in July of 2016. We traveled to Hong Kong and Taipei in April and stayed at two great Airbnbs. Last winter we traveled to Tulum and found a very cool Airbnb in the jungle.  We hope travel again this winter to some place warm. We are also hoping to take a trip this summer to Italy to visit friends.

name: Puddingstone 45 #3
host_about:
Paramount in my life is being happy; absolutely everything else is secondary-- it is a very fulfilling experience.

Hosting and meeting people from all over the world is amazing- it makes me happy also; it is incredible what technology has allowed us to achieve in this way, here it is actually bringing people together.  Since I started hosting guests with Air' I have established some of the most spectacular friendships, exceeding my expectations.  It is this unique chemistry between the guest and host that makes this interaction so fulfilling.  Curiosity, knowledge building, experience, kindness, intrigue, diversity and necessity all play a part.  To all guest past and future.... thank you.   

Enjoy writing, photography, reading, research, traveling, sailing and diving and cycling.  Former restaurant owner.  Volunteer, supporting community efforts and local business. Environmentalist; currently working on a book(Peering into the Future).

name: Marriott Custom House in Boston
Studio in the heart of Boston! Furnished!
Cozy Three Bedroom Apt in the North End!
host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: Private Room in Heart of Historic North End
host_about:
Exploring new places is one of the great joys in life.
My favorite way to see a city is form the water. My favorite way to experience a city is on a bicycle. 
On trips, I like to wander, visit museums, see shows, and reconnect with old friends.I also enjoy trying to find good food and better drinks. 
Whether I'm traveling or at home, I usually go out to Jitterbug several nights a week. (nerd) 
I have lived abroad (England and Australia) and traveled as much as I've been able to over the last 10 years. I consider myself a seasoned traveler and not much ruffles my feathers at this point. 
As a guest I am easy going and self-sufficient. Since I moved to New Orleans, I have experienced many many types of house guests. As a result, I have become even more considerate. I live by the rule to leave things as you found them.

I leave you with a quote: "Unusual travel suggestions are dancing lessons from God" -Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

name: North End One Bedroom Apartment w/ futon couch!
host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids. name: Luxury 3 BR |1 Bath Apartment near Seaport/BCEC
host_about: I live in Boston though am originally from upstate NY. I love traveling and am a huge gastronome so very much enjoy exploring a city’s food and cocktail scene. To help bring balance,  I find enjoyment in movement so I make time to Crossfit , run , spin - you name it -to stay active wherever I go.

name: Fort Hill top -1Bk  Private room in townhouse
host_about:
Hi, we are Kevin & Fran, a married multicultural couple (US/Italian + German).
Kevin is a professional classical musician (he doesn't practice at home) - you can learn more at Kevin's website - si parla Inglese e l'Italiano.
Kevin's wife Fran is a German physician.

As we are transferring to Munich by July 1, 2019, we have Nik and Alessia (two post-docs, they are a couple and will move into the 4th bedroom (which is currently ours) on Aug 23 and stay for at least a year) as our long-term renters and AirBnB "surrogate hosts". For the other available bedrooms, the renters have been international researchers/postdocs/physicians that are looking for a quiet place to wind down after busy days and we look forward to continuing this tradition as this was always a great fit. 
Our friend Kellie lives in Boston(West Roxbury) and will manage everything locally (e.g. if something is not working properly). Kevin is anticipating to come to Boston every couple of months. Kellie and Kevin will both monitor the AirBnB messages.

name: Stunning Quaint Tremont Studio!!
Sunny Allston Bedroom
Longwood Hospitals★Walk to Subway★Free parking
host_about: I have been living in Boston for years since college and I love this city! That is the main reason why I want to share my wonderful experience in Boston to anyone who's visiting here! As a host I'm doing my best to ensure all guests are staying comfortably and get to know the local Bostoners' life. Don't hesitate to ask if you have any questions!

name: Quiet & Convenient 1 BR Hideaway
host_about:
"It is the unemotional, reserved, calm, detached warrior who wins, not the hothead seeking vengeance and not the ambitious seeker of fortune.

-Sun Tzu

Infinite striving to be the best is man's duty; it is its own reward.

name: CHARMING 1BR IN AMAZING NEIGHBORHOOD
Cozy one bedroom apartment in central Bay Village
NEW! Walk Everywhere Downtown, 1BR Modern Loft

name: Eagle Hill
Entire Apartment, 2BR/1BA in Heart of North End
host_about:
Exploring new places is one of the great joys in life.
My favorite way to see a city is form the water. My favorite way to experience a city is on a bicycle. 
On trips, I like to wander, visit museums, see shows, and reconnect with old friends.I also enjoy trying to find good food and better drinks. 
Whether I'm traveling or at home, I usually go out to Jitterbug several nights a week. (nerd) 
I have lived abroad (England and Australia) and traveled as much as I've been able to over the last 10 years. I consider myself a seasoned traveler and not much ruffles my feathers at this point. 
As a guest I am easy going and self-sufficient. Since I moved to New Orleans, I have experienced many many types of house guests. As a result, I have become even more considerate. I live by the rule to leave things as you found them.

I leave you with a quote: "Unusual travel suggestions are dancing lessons from God" -Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

name: Luxurious 6 BR House in Boston, Keyless Entry!
Downtown Crossing, 1 Bed Apt, Boston
host_about:
My name is Adam and I am a Sales Representative for Compass Furnished Apartments. We offer short-term and long-term fully furnished, fully equipped apartments in the Northeastern United States. 

Our comfortable homes, streamlined reservation process and “concierge-style” client services enable us to provide our guests with an exceptional experience, all at a tremendous value.

Our forward looking approach to technology and sustainable business practices coupled with our experience in evaluating and fulfilling the specific needs of every client lead many to choose Compass for their furnished apartment needs.

name: Sunny, Central, 1BDR on beautiful Newbury street
host_about:
ABOUT ME

In a nutshell: I'm a traveller, researcher, musician, fairly accomplished programmer, avid skier, and a general lover of life and everything to do with it.

In a slightly larger nutshell: I'm Petar. I was born in Cambridge, MA but moved back to Serbia a few months later. Lived there until 1999 when we moved back to the United States. I consider myself very lucky to be a child of two continents - this has allowed me to travel most of the world, and have fantastic times experiencing all of the different cultures, histories, and adventures that our little planet has to offer. I decided to join up on here as I wanted to expand my traveling network, and travel all over the world! For those who stay at my place - I know the Boston area in and out, and would be more than glad to show you what this fantastic city has to offer, and provide great accommodation. 

I'm a collector of memories, not things :)

Why I’m on AirBnB

The world is truly full of amazing people. When I'm not traveling, I'm happy to put up my place - I find it's a great way to travel, meet exceptional people and have fantastic experiences.

Interests

Many of my friends have described me as a renaissance man. If something interests me, I'll usually go out of my way to try it out. Currently, I've been on a bit of a language learning streak - I'm trying to get my German, French, and Italian to fairly passable levels. Thank God my Spanish is up to par!

Other than that, I've become quite interested in Art Deco architecture, and designs from that era. Can anyone say Bahaus?

Professionally, I'm a computer programmer, and a researcher in high performance computing. In this regard my interests, which probably bore pretty much everyone else have to do with efficient memory and cache, multithreaded program design, and all that other fun stuff.

name: Private room with 1 queen, 1 twin beds, Boston, MA
Flat in the Jamaica Plain Hills
★Professional & Bright Bedroom at Family Home★
host_about:
Welcome to our Airbnb!

Started in Summer 2016, we have continued to dedicatedly accommodate guests from across the country and around the world. The homeowners are Hieu and Kim, the kindest and most hospitable owner's around.

As for us- your Airbnb Managers!

Curt is an entrepreneurial Biochemistry/Pre-Med graduate, currently volunteering in Pediatric Emergency at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH). Hosting while preparing for medical school, he'd gladly put a band-aid on your boo-boo when needed! Thanh is a working professional as Pharmacy Technician for Boston Children's Hospital (#1 ). She looves to bake and has contributed to the successful opening of popular local cafes!

Amongst our daily lives, we've discovered this way of meeting diverse people and have become passionate about hosting our guests. Our house is made welcome to you. As fellow traveler's, we understand the importance of experiencing a reliable, enjoyable, and successful trip. In return, we expect the same respect and kindness while staying in our home.

We appreciate you taking the time to consider staying with us and are always open to responding to inquiries. Hope to see you soon, and have a safe journey!

name: Cozy Three Bedroom Apartment in Jamaica Plain
3-bed: Verdant JP Delite, Straight Shot Into Town!
host_about:
I'm a freelance journalist, and nowadays I write mostly about information security, technology careers, diabetes and other health issues. I work from home, so I'm usually here to help my guests out in any way I can. My boyfriend, John, lives here, and if I'm not here to welcome you and give you tips on enjoying Boston, he'll do the honors!

I'm mad about organic gardening, used to keep bees but don't anymore, and my yard is a jungle full of birds and fruit that I wish the birds would let me eat.

I grow things. The garden is one of the best things about this house. It's gotten a little insane. Growth is a little rampant. It might eat you before you reach the front door. I apologize. Send up a flare!

Some of the most amazing times in my life have come about through traveling or hosting travelers to this beautiful city. I love meeting new people, hearing about their adventures, learning more about where they come from, and helping them have a wonderful time here in Boston. 

I've had Thai people help me count the steps out loud in Thai when visiting  a mountain temple in Chiang Mai. I've kayaked from Cambridge, down the Charles River, through the locks, out into Boston Harbor, and into a dock outside The Barking Crab restaurant for a lunch of fried clams—a local favorite! I've been to New Orleans to work with Habitat for Humanity in rebuilding after Hurricane Katrina. I've hiked the White Mountains. I've trekked France, I've studied Spanish in Madrid, I've tossed bread crumbs to fish in Greece. 

Come to Boston, and I'll do everything I can to make sure you make wonderful new travel memories here, dining under my grape arbor, visiting your children's college, walking the Freedom Trail or whatever else you wind up doing!

host_about:
Paramount in my life is being happy; absolutely everything else is secondary-- it is a very fulfilling experience.

Hosting and meeting people from all over the world is amazing- it makes me happy also; it is incredible what technology has allowed us to achieve in this way, here it is actually bringing people together.  Since I started hosting guests with Air' I have established some of the most spectacular friendships, exceeding my expectations.  It is this unique chemistry between the guest and host that makes this interaction so fulfilling.  Curiosity, knowledge building, experience, kindness, intrigue, diversity and necessity all play a part.  To all guest past and future.... thank you.   

Enjoy writing, photography, reading, research, traveling, sailing and diving and cycling.  Former restaurant owner.  Volunteer, supporting community efforts and local business. Environmentalist; currently working on a book(Peering into the Future).

- Edward & Alan

host_about: Welcome.  I am a tenured Boston resident with a true love and appreciation for my city.  Need help planning your trip here?  Feel free to reach out.  I will share all my favorite spots.  As for me, I love walks in the woods and parks with my poodle, Frodo.  I am an avid gardener, love Mah Jong,  and am actively involved with my library Friend Group.

name: ★ The Elephant Room at Ashmont | T Downtown ★
host_about:
Hi There!

We are Romo and Nayeli - a young married couple living in Boston.

We are both originally from Texas, but met and got married in China. We both love to travel and are always planning new adventures.  Anywhere we go, we are always seeking for the latest culinary experience or that perfect balanced cocktail from a local bar tender.

Right behind traveling, we both absolutely love to host!  We truly believe that hospitality is the art of making others feel welcome, comfortable, and at home.  It's the talent for spreading warmth and kindness that will be remembered always.  
 
Now, we have both lived abroad for a great part of our lives.  Nayeli spent time in Africa and went to school in France before moving to Asia.  I, on the other hand, spent time studying in Spain before moving to Beijing  in 2000 after graduating.  

Nayeli and I met in Shenzhen, China in 2010 and in 2015 we tied the knot in the great city of Shanghai.  Shortly thereafter, In 2016, we decided to repatriate back to the US after 16 years of living and working abroad.

We both had great experiences traveling in Asia, and we felt compelled to return back to the Americas and try to replicate the same adventures here at home.  We are now both very happy to be back in the US, and even more so when we get the opportunity to call Boston home.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

If this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: https://www.airbnb.com/c/eddier972?currency=USD

name: Modern 1-bd Downtown for professionals & Families1
host_about:
Hi there!
Thanks for looking into my profile . My name is Hasan. I work for a financial technology firm as a head of business development. As a side gig, I have been an airbnb host for 3 years managing 8 units in Boston and Cambridge. 

As you may have already seen, hotel prices are insanely expensive in Boston.  Thankfully, we are still able to offer affordable stays for those who are on a tight budget for their travel despite the fact that the city and hotel lobbies are cracking down on airbnb.

Why Do I host?
 I love the fact that people can still find affordable stays through Airbnb. When a family of 4 visits their daughter in May for graduation, they can book a place for $250/night instead of paying over $1000/night for a hotel stay. It means a lot to me! ( there was a time my parents could not come from overseas to visit me just because we could not afford their stay! ) 

My priority is to provide well located affordable stays to families and business travelers. I guarantee you that you will find a clean, well designed and conveniently located units with 24/7 assistance . 

However, if you have high standards, luxury buildings or jacuzzi tubs in the unit, my apartments may not be best option for you: Considering over $4000/month rents for a rundown building in Boston, I am not able to afford high end buildings to host guests on airbnb. You shall look for different options for your satisfactions. 

For others, I am more than happy to host you! Let's keep this community happy

Regards,
Hasan

name: ⭐SUPERHOST NEW GEM⭐Chic Bunker Hill Penthouse❤
host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

name: Jamaica Plain Spacious 3 Room Apartment w/prvtbath
host_about:
Life has been and continues to be an interesting endeavor. Growing up in South Florida and having lived in Düsseldorf,Germany,Rabat,Morocco,Mystic Connecticut, Minneapolis,Minnesota,Portland,Oregon,Sacramento,California,New York, New York,Boston,Massachusetts among other places I have noticed a few things. Persuing a career in music brought me to the Northeast. I really enjoy the cultural offerings a place like Boston has to offer. The intellectual community surrounding the colleges. The artists, musicians,museums,concert halls,night clubs,etc have a way of making me want to stick around here. Not to mention the medical community ,hospitals ,researching (Website hidden by Airbnb) a beautiful place to live too. So close to the Ski areas. I love snowboarding myself. Business wise it's not lacking either. I have always had a travel bug and can appreciate it in others my recent trips were Chiapas, Mexico and Yerevan, Armeni (Website hidden by Airbnb) As a host I like to be sure the place meets high   standards  of cleanliness. This is my home but I hardly ever cook here ...You should  Expect some modicum of privacy from me  in the kitchen in other words.Boston has been good to me and if I had a life motto it would be " What kind of idiot freezes Ted William's head anyway?";p
 As a guest I'm low impact. I'll leave the place like it was when I  found it...I don't mind being sociable on the way in or out...

host_about:
Boston Park Plaza is so much more than a hotel. We are a Boston icon that is as much a part of the city’s heritage as the Boston Tea Party and the annual Head of the Charles Regatta. We offer an experience that is truly one-of-a-kind, a place where you can enjoy a richly textured and profoundly memorable taste of the real Boston.

Following a landmark renovation, our hotel, Boston Park Plaza offers guests all the charisma and deeply individual charm of a historic hotel with the effortless comforts of a new one. Once again a destination unto itself, our hotel offers incomparable proximity to everything that makes Boston a treasured destination. We are one of the most sought-after hotels near Boston Common and enjoy an ideal location among the hotels in downtown Boston, just steps away from the Public Garden, Theater District and many of the city’s most popular historical sites.

When you’re looking for the best hotel, Boston Park Plaza provides an unrivaled legacy of service. When Boston Park Plaza opened in 1927, it redefined a standard of hospitality that guests came to expect. With our history of innovation and continued dedication to our guests, we are proud to be recognized as Boston’s Most Beloved.

name: CLEAN AND BEAUTIFUL 1 BEDROOM HEART OF BOSTON
Quaint room in Hyde Park
host_about: Hi! My name is Maria Petruccelli, I’m 46, and I’m originally from Brazil. I like to travel, complete puzzles, cook, and go thrifting! I’m very outgoing and will talk your ear off if you let me! I work at tufts health plan center in Watertown part time. I also have a background in cleaning so I keep my house immaculate. I also work for Rover, so I occasionally pet sit dogs, if you are not comfortable with dogs, please let me know and I will make sure not to book any clients during your stay. If I were to pet sit, the dog will be mostly out of your way and not in your personal room, just please let me know what you are comfortable with and I will work with that. I have a daughter who is currently in college so I am becoming a host to make a little extra income. I am looking forward to hosting you!

name: Walk to the city or beach 4
host_about: Stacy and I love to travel! Some of our favorite destinations are Croatia, Bosnia, Egypt, Italy, Cape Verde and Greece. Traveling comes from our love of culture and history. We love to participate in local adventures, attend events happening wherever we are, but most importantly, meet new people and try new cuisines!  Music is a huge part of our lives, all genres, and if we have down time, we kick up our feet and watch a movie! We can tell you where to go for the best restaurants and events happening around the city.  Keeping up to date with new dining and entertainment venues is something we really enjoy. We work a ton and don't get away as much as we like lately, so we love to entertain and are also Airbnb hosts.  We both have hospitality industry experience and keeping our guests happy and providing them with all of the information they need to enjoy their stay is one of the best parts of hosting. We look forward to meeting you during our travels or in the company of our home! Come stay with us and experience Boston like a local!

name: Large Room
Mama Sarah's home away from home.
host_about:
I am retired, widowed, mother of two adult sons.  My husband was in the US Army for over twenty years so we did travel a bit.  Both my sons were born in Frankfurt, Germany.  My family and friends say I am a good cook and hostess and for the last 20 years or so, Christmas has been hosted at our house.   I love to travel, usually to Europe and Africa.  I love watching documentaries and exposing myself to other cultures and languages.
I enjoy reading, especially old classics.  I enjoy going to the movies.  I last saw Ladybird, The Greenbook, Colette and On the Basis of Sex.  In the summer, I enjoy gardening, walking around the waterfront (Boston) and going to outdoor events showcasing music, crafts, and ethnic foods.
My life motto is, "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you."  As a host, I make every effort to make sure my guests feel comfortable in my home (Website hidden by Airbnb) can live just about anywhere as long as I have a good book to get lost in, good music and/or good company.

host_about: Welcome y’all! My name is Gregory. I am 50 years old and originally from a small town Georgia. I came up to Boston 26 years ago to continue my education and enter the finance industry. I fell in love with Beantown and never left. Looking forward to sharing that love of the city, my place and all its hidden gems with you, your family, and friends. I might even sneak in a little southern hospitality if given the chance. Avid outdoors man that enjoys all that New England has to offer. From snowboarding at one of the easiest to get to mountains to fish for trophy blue fin out on the banks. Don’t be shy to ask about other interesting activities around the Boston.

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: H9, 2 min walk to T/Subway, 17 min to Downtown
host_about:
Just like many of you, I have a wanderlust. I always love the adventure of travel – the unknown, something different, something new.  I have been extremely lucky to continuously feed my passion for travel. 

I love the excitement of it all–feeling like an explorer–discovering a new land, a new language, new money and all the little challenges that go along with it. When I travel, I am more spontaneous and don't live for the future or the past… just in the moment. 

I love the rush. Habitual runners get off on the kick-in of endorphins that give them that extra boost they need to keep going. I get the same jolt from a day of travel or an unexpected side trip to a new and undiscovered land that I hadn't planned to visit.  Traveling seems to give me a near constant adrenaline rush.  After a few years of uninterrupted travel, I became quite addicted to this feeling. 

I love the logistics. I like landing in a new place and trying to figure it all out myself. Where to get money. How to speak the language. How to go from point A to point B. How to pack my bag right so I don't go insane after packing it for the 135th time. 

I love meeting new people all the time. In no other time in my life have I met so many people and made so many new friends in such a short time.  The world is full of friendly, generous people. 

I love the freedom. I experience a great feeling of independence from traveling. I can go wherever I want, whenever I want. I can sleep in. I can stay out late. It's all up to me.

name: NICE, QUIET, CHARMING 2-BR APT
Beautiful Huge Studio in Theatre District
Belgrade Place
Luxurious Brand New 2 Bedroom Suite!
Cozy Private Room
★ The Boiler Room at Ashmont | T Downtown ★
host_about:
Hi There!

We are Romo and Nayeli - a young married couple living in Boston.

We are both originally from Texas, but met and got married in China. We both love to travel and are always planning new adventures.  Anywhere we go, we are always seeking for the latest culinary experience or that perfect balanced cocktail from a local bar tender.

Right behind traveling, we both absolutely love to host!  We truly believe that hospitality is the art of making others feel welcome, comfortable, and at home.  It's the talent for spreading warmth and kindness that will be remembered always.  
 
Now, we have both lived abroad for a great part of our lives.  Nayeli spent time in Africa and went to school in France before moving to Asia.  I, on the other hand, spent time studying in Spain before moving to Beijing  in 2000 after graduating.  

Nayeli and I met in Shenzhen, China in 2010 and in 2015 we tied the knot in the great city of Shanghai.  Shortly thereafter, In 2016, we decided to repatriate back to the US after 16 years of living and working abroad.

We both had great experiences traveling in Asia, and we felt compelled to return back to the Americas and try to replicate the same adventures here at home.  We are now both very happy to be back in the US, and even more so when we get the opportunity to call Boston home.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

If this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: https://www.airbnb.com/c/eddier972?currency=USD

name: 5.bostonparkplaza · DELUXE TWO QUEENS
host_about:
Boston Park Plaza is so much more than a hotel. We are a Boston icon that is as much a part of the city’s heritage as the Boston Tea Party and the annual Head of the Charles Regatta. We offer an experience that is truly one-of-a-kind, a place where you can enjoy a richly textured and profoundly memorable taste of the real Boston.

Following a landmark renovation, our hotel, Boston Park Plaza offers guests all the charisma and deeply individual charm of a historic hotel with the effortless comforts of a new one. Once again a destination unto itself, our hotel offers incomparable proximity to everything that makes Boston a treasured destination. We are one of the most sought-after hotels near Boston Common and enjoy an ideal location among the hotels in downtown Boston, just steps away from the Public Garden, Theater District and many of the city’s most popular historical sites.

When you’re looking for the best hotel, Boston Park Plaza provides an unrivaled legacy of service. When Boston Park Plaza opened in 1927, it redefined a standard of hospitality that guests came to expect. With our history of innovation and continued dedication to our guests, we are proud to be recognized as Boston’s Most Beloved.

name: Beautiful Private Quarters on Centre and Green St.
host_about:
I'm a Pakistani girl who grew up in the U.S., bred in West Philly, and had been living in Italy for five years, now living in Boston.

I lived in rural Piedmont for 4.5 years and studied at The University of Gastronomic Sciences in Bra developing social and community projects with Slow Food related to food anthropology, and working as a line cook. I now live and work in Milan.

I speak English, Italian, and basic Urdu and basic Spanish.

I really enjoy staying with new people and hosting new people in my own home.

As a guest in peoples' homes, I tend to stick by a couple rules: 
1) Leave everything as I found it, or neater.
2) Be-friend my host. 
3) Leave a small thank you.

As a host to potential guests, I hope to encounter the same gestures in people.

name: Stylish Charlestown home w/ backyard and fire pit
Colonial Room
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm originally from Atlanta but have been living Boston in the famous the North End of Boston for the last 15 years.  Last summer I had the pleasure of AirBnB'ing in St. Petersburg Florida and I'm looking forward to continuing that here in Boston.  I owned and operated a hostel in downtown Boston for six years and I'm a big fan of hostels, so the spaces I rent are often shared.
.  
I love traveling, meeting travelers and helping them out with finding affordable accommodation where ever I am.  I'm opening another hostel soon and thought this would be a great way to continue what I like to do in the meantime.  Safe Travels!!

name: Boston Common One Bedroom Apartment Downtown
host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: TEST
Gorgeous Beacon Hill 1BR | 1BA
host_about:
Hello!
My husband and I are young professionals living in Beacon Hill in Boston.  Matt is a software engineer at a local Boston company, while I am a dance team coach at a university.  I like watching Patriots games, dancing, and relaxing with a good book.  Matt enjoys cooking, spending time with friends, and running on the Charles River.  We both love to spend our free time traveling and exploring new places.  We also love hosting guests and it would be our pleasure to host you during your travels!

name: 3A BU Medical/NEU sunny cozy room

host_about:
Hi I'm Lucy

I am a ballet/dance instructor. Originally from Tokyo, Japan, lived in Providence, RI for many years. I live in Cotuit with my fiancé , Scott now.
I am friendly and LOVE to host my friends and family so it was almost "meant to be" to sign up with Airbnb to become a host for Scott's lovely flat in Beacon Hill, Boston which he has owned for many years and only uses occasionally. (he teaches graduate students in Cambridge)
I am easy going and friendly.  I want all my guests to have a fantastic, memorable , and headache free (most importantly!) stay in Boston whether you are there with your friends and family or alone for business.

name: Sunny, upper floor facing the State House!
host_about: I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband, sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts, is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding, jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making, live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups, birthday parties, bachelorette parties, make your own wedding bands, create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

name: 2bd/1ba Condo with 2 KING Size Beds in Allston
host_about:
I'm a long time traveler and longtime Bostonian.

I have always appreciated a variety of experiences and I've done it all, from Hostel, to the Airbnb "Live live like a local", to the 5-Star Hotel experience.  They all have their benefits.

I'm recently retired, having spent 25 years in the financial services industry.  The last 10+ as a project manager.  

As part of my work responsibilities, I was regularly traveling to India.  I enjoyed the cultural exchange opportunity just as much as the project work and have been learning the Hindi language with a private tutor for the last few years.

Learning a new language later in life presents some additional and unique challenges.  My dirty little secret is that, as a native English speaker, at this point I think I know more Hindi grammar than English grammar :-)

I continue to look forward to seeing new places and meeting new people.  

If you are coming to Boston, I look forward to hosting you!

If I am heading out to your neck of the woods, I look forward to exploring your city and country!

name: Bright and Cozy Boston Studio near Subway
host_about:
Thank you for looking up on my profile! My name is Cindy, part of the Nora House team of 6 friends. I'm traveling globetrotter, real estate professional, homeowner, mother of two, and also a neat freak. My main task at the Nora house team is communication and make sure all guest are happy with the accommodation. 

We have been renting through Airbnb for 2 years, and all of us really enjoyed hosting people from all walks of life. And profoundly appreciate the income generated by it to provide for our families

What differentiates us from other host are: we truly care about each guest, and we always try our very best to accommodate. We try to use as much white as we can in our units including linen and towel, so any dirt could be easily discovered. 

We set our automated pricing tool to be at least 20% lower than other similar Airbnb's in the area, and at least 40% lower than surrounding hotels. Please be considerate when using AC and leave the apartment in a manageable condition to help us keep the cost low.

host_about: My husband Chris and I live along with our 1 year old daughter in Jamaica Plain, just a few miles from downtown Boston and our rental property in the South End. We're easy going and respectful grown-ups, and we think staying in hotels is for chumps and love learning a new place by getting a sense of what it would feel like to live there.  We're passionate about movies, good tv, books, and music.  We prefer to be outdoors whenever the weather's nice and ride our bikes just about everywhere.  We love good, simple food, with a tendency towards vegetarian/pescatarian.  Claire's a film and commercial producer and Chris is an epidemiologist.  Get in touch to ask us anything about our lovely South End apartment!

name: The Greenhouse Apartments
Lux 2 Bedroom near Boston Children's Hospital
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
